Web frameworks for clojure

23 Nov 2011

Clojure has a number of frameworks for building web applications.

  • Ring: De facto standard base for writing web applications in Clojure.
  • Compojure: small web framework to generate Ring handler functions.
  • Moustache: micro web framework with DSL to wire Ring handlers and middlewares
  • Noir: another micro web framework to write Ring handlers and middlewares

Ring

Hello world in Ring

(ns hello-world.core
  (use ring.adapter.jetty))
<span class="p">(</span><span class="nf">ns</span> <span class="nv">hello-world</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="nv">core</span>
  <span class="p">(</span><span class="nf">use</span> <span class="nv">ring</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="nv">adapter</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="nv">jetty</span><span class="p">))</span>


(defn handler [request]

  {:status 200

   :headers {"Content-Type" "text/html"}

   :body "Hello World"})


(run-jetty handler {:port 8080})








Compojure


Hello world in Compojure


(ns hello-world
  (:use compojure.core, ring.adapter.jetty)
  (:require [compojure.route :as route]))
<span class="p">(</span><span class="nf">ns</span> <span class="nv">hello-world</span>
  <span class="p">(</span><span class="nf">:use</span> <span class="nv">compojure</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="nv">core,</span> <span class="nv">ring</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="nv">adapter</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="nv">jetty</span><span class="p">)</span>
  <span class="p">(</span><span class="nf">:require</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="nv">compojure</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="nv">route</span> <span class="nv">:as</span> <span class="nv">route</span><span class="p">]))</span>


(defroutes main-routes

  (GET "/" [] "<h1>Hello World</h1>")

  (route/not-found "<h1>Page not found</h1>"))


(run-jetty main-routes {:port 8080})








Noir


Hello world in Noir


(ns my-app
  (:use noir.core)
  (:require [noir.server :as server]))
<span class="p">(</span><span class="nf">ns</span> <span class="nv">my-app</span>
  <span class="p">(</span><span class="nf">:use</span> <span class="nv">noir</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="nv">core</span><span class="p">)</span>
  <span class="p">(</span><span class="nf">:require</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="nv">noir</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="nv">server</span> <span class="nv">:as</span> <span class="nv">server</span><span class="p">]))</span>


(defpage "/welcome" []

  "Hello world")


(server/start 8080)
